relationships.description: Long-time advisor to China's leaders and Chinese government

analysis.purpose: To provide China's perspective on US-China trade war and tariff policies
analysis.significance: Insight into Chinese government thinking on trade relations from a trusted advisor

notable_quotes: China says it was doing what was appropriate under the WTO because it was a developing country. Now that it's advanced, it's opening markets.
China needs to make some specific changes regarding markets, IPR, some of these other things â€” they should be done subtlety and not publicly. That's the way to get things done.
As China is saying they will not be blackmailed to doing these things.

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail or coercion. The term 'blackmailed' is used by the host in reference to China's position on trade negotiations, not as an actual blackmail situation.

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed. This is a policy discussion about trade relations between nations.

public_knowledge.context: This appears to be a public CNN interview transcript discussing widely reported US-China trade war issues from 2018

analysis.summary: CNN interview with Robert Lawrence Kuhn, a China advisor, discussing the US-China trade war, tariff impacts, and China's perspective on trade negotiations, intellectual property protection, and market opening policies.
